comment: * Reusable methods for generating touch events. These methods can be used with * InstrumentationTestCase or ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2 to simulate user interaction with * the application through a touch screen. * * @deprecated Use * Espresso UI testing * framework instead. New tests should be written using the * Android Testing Support Library.

methods.name: public static void dragQuarterScreenDown(ActivityInstrumentationTestCase test)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching in the center of the screen and dragging one quarter of the way down
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     *
     * @deprecated {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase} is deprecated in favor of
     * {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2}, which provides more options for
     * configuring the Activity under test

methods.name: public static void dragQuarterScreenDown(InstrumentationTestCase test, Activity activity)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching in the center of the screen and dragging one quarter of the way down
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param activity The activity that is in the foreground of the test case

methods.name: public static void tapView(InstrumentationTestCase test, View v)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching the center of a view and releasing quickly (before the tap timeout).
     *
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param v The view that should be clicked

methods.name: public static void touchAndCancelView(InstrumentationTestCase test, View v)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching the center of a view and cancelling (so no onClick should
     * fire, etc).

     * @param v The view that should be clicked

methods.comment:
* Simulate touching the center of a view and releasing.

     * @param v The view that should be clicked

methods.name: private static void getStartLocation(View v, int gravity, int[] xy)
methods.comment:
* Get the location of a view. Use the gravity param to specify which part of the view to
     * return.
     *
     * @param v View to find
     * @param gravity A combination of (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL,
     *        RIGHT)
     * @param xy Result

methods.name: public static int dragViewBy(ActivityInstrumentationTestCase test, View v, int gravity, int deltaX, int deltaY)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching a view and dragging it by the specified amount.
     *
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param v The view that should be dragged
     * @param gravity Which part of the view to use for the initial down event. A combination of
     *        (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, RIGHT)
     * @param deltaX Amount to drag horizontally in pixels
     * @param deltaY Amount to drag vertically in pixels
     *
     * @return distance in pixels covered by the drag
     *
     * @deprecated {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase} is deprecated in favor of
     * {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2}, which provides more options for
     * configuring the Activity under test

methods.name: public static int dragViewBy(InstrumentationTestCase test, View v, int gravity, int deltaX, int deltaY)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching a view and dragging it by the specified amount.
     *
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param v The view that should be dragged
     * @param gravity Which part of the view to use for the initial down event. A combination of
     *        (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, RIGHT)
     * @param deltaX Amount to drag horizontally in pixels
     * @param deltaY Amount to drag vertically in pixels
     *
     * @return distance in pixels covered by the drag
     *
     * @deprecated {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase} is deprecated in favor of
     * {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2}, which provides more options for
     * configuring the Activity under test

methods.name: public static int dragViewTo(ActivityInstrumentationTestCase test, View v, int gravity, int toX, int toY)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching a view and dragging it to a specified location.
     *
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param v The view that should be dragged
     * @param gravity Which part of the view to use for the initial down event. A combination of
     *        (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, RIGHT)
     * @param toX Final location of the view after dragging
     * @param toY Final location of the view after dragging
     *
     * @return distance in pixels covered by the drag
     *
     * @deprecated {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase} is deprecated in favor of
     * {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2}, which provides more options for
     * configuring the Activity under test

methods.name: public static int dragViewTo(InstrumentationTestCase test, View v, int gravity, int toX, int toY)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching a view and dragging it to a specified location.
     *
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param v The view that should be dragged
     * @param gravity Which part of the view to use for the initial down event. A combination of
     *        (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, RIGHT)
     * @param toX Final location of the view after dragging
     * @param toY Final location of the view after dragging
     *
     * @return distance in pixels covered by the drag

methods.name: public static int dragViewToX(ActivityInstrumentationTestCase test, View v, int gravity, int toX)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching a view and dragging it to a specified location. Only moves horizontally.

     * @param toX Final location of the view after dragging
     *
     * @return distance in pixels covered by the drag

     * {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2}, which provides more options for
     * configuring the Activity under test

methods.name: public static int dragViewToX(InstrumentationTestCase test, View v, int gravity, int toX)
methods.comment:

methods.name: public static void drag(ActivityInstrumentationTestCase test, float fromX, float toX, float fromY, float toY, int stepCount)
methods.comment:
* Simulate touching a specific location and dragging to a new location.
     *
     * @param test The test case that is being run
     * @param fromX X coordinate of the initial touch, in screen coordinates
     * @param toX Xcoordinate of the drag destination, in screen coordinates
     * @param fromY X coordinate of the initial touch, in screen coordinates
     * @param toY Y coordinate of the drag destination, in screen coordinates
     * @param stepCount How many move steps to include in the drag
     *
     * @deprecated {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase} is deprecated in favor of
     * {@link android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2}, which provides more options for
     * configuring the Activity under test

     * @param fromY X coordinate of the initial touch, in screen coordinates
     * @param toY Y coordinate of the drag destination, in screen coordinates
     * @param stepCount How many move steps to include in the drag
